methods.javadoc:
Returns the number of elements in the array
@return the number of elements in the array
methods.name: getNumElements
methods.comment: Returns the number of elements in the array

return.comment: the number of elements in the array

methods.javadoc:
Returns the length of an element in the array
@return the length of one element in the array.
methods.name: getElementLength
methods.comment: Returns the length of an element in the array

return.comment: the length of one element in the array.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the dataType of the elements in the array.
@return the dataType of the elements in the array
methods.name: getDataType
methods.comment: Returns the dataType of the elements in the array.

return.comment: the dataType of the elements in the array

methods.name: getArrayDefaultLabelPrefix
methods.comment:
Get the appropriate string to use as the label prefix
 for an array, taking into account the actual data at the memory location.
 
 See also #getDefaultLabelPrefix()

params.name: options
params.comment: options for how to format the default label prefix.

return.comment: the label prefix or null if not applicable

methods.name: getArrayDefaultOffcutLabelPrefix
methods.comment:
Get the appropriate string to use as the offcut label prefix for an array, taking into
 account the actual data at the memory location.
 
 See also #getDefaultLabelPrefix()

params.name: options
params.comment: options for how to format the default label prefix.

params.name: offcutLength
params.comment: offcut offset from start of buf

return.comment: the offcut label prefix or null if not applicable

methods.name: getArrayRepresentation
methods.comment:
Get the representation which corresponds to an array in memory.  This will either be a
 String for the ArrayStringable case, "??" for uninitialized data,
 or the empty string if it is not.

return.comment: a String if it is an array of chars; otherwise empty string, never null.

methods.name: getArrayValue
methods.comment:
Get the value object which corresponds to an array in memory.  This will either be a
 String for the ArrayStringable case or null.

return.comment: a String if it is an array of chars; otherwise null.

methods.name: getArrayValueClass
methods.comment:
Get the value Class of a specific arrayDt with settings
 ( see #getArrayValueClass(Array, Settings) ).

params.name: settings
params.comment: the relevant settings to use or null for default.

return.comment:
Class of the value to be returned by the array or null if it can vary
 or is unspecified (String or Array class will be returned).
